newsitem.title: USA: Conoco 97 capital expenditures at $2.25 bln.
newsitem.headline: Conoco 97 capital expenditures at $2.25 bln.

text.p: Conoco Inc said Thursday it will spend about $2.25 billion for capital items and cash exploration in 1997, roughly equal its 1996 expenditures.

The company said most of the money will be for worldwide exploration, production and natural gas activities. Refining, marketing and transportation will cost about $560 million, with another $75 million earmarked for its global power business, Conoco said.
It said about $1.6 billion will be spend internationally, and $650 million will be spent in the United States.
Conoco is a subsidiary of the DuPont Co.
